title: Red Sox's Henry, disgruntled Devers have sit-down
content: Red Sox owner John Henry flew to Kansas City to have a sit-down with disgruntled star Rafael Devers, who told the team he would not move to first base.

title: Banged-up Cavs get tough, win 'now or never' G3
content: Darius Garland, Evan Mobley and De'Andre Hunter returned from injuries to help the Cavs pull out a 126-104 over the Pacers and avoid falling into a 3-0 series hole.

title: Marchand's OT score cuts Panthers' deficit to 2-1
content: Brad Marchand scored on a deflected shot at 15:27 of overtime and the Panthers beat the Maple Leafs 5-4 in Game 3 on Friday night to cut their deficit in the Eastern Conference semifinal series to 2-1.

title: Dominguez socks A's with 3 HRs as Yanks roll
content: Jasson Dominguez homered three times for the New York Yankees against the Athletics in by far the most prolific game of his career.

title: Riley not sorry on Butler call, eyes Heat overhaul
content: Addressing the Jimmy Butler situation for the first time since the forward was traded to the Warriors, Pat Riley said that he wishes Butler well. He also said he expects the Heat to make roster changes in the offseason.

title: UNC: Belichick's girlfriend welcome at school
content: North Carolina issued a statement saying Bill Belichick's girlfriend is still welcome at football facilities.

title: Pats DC Williams' absence due to 'health scare'
content: Patriots defensive coordinator Terrell Williams is not with the team for this week's rookie minicamp due to a recent "health scare," he told reporters Friday.

title: Sean Taylor's brother Gabe in Commanders camp
content: Gabe Taylor, younger brother of late Washington safety Sean Taylor, is attending Commanders rookie camp.

title: The NFL draft picks who landed with the perfect team: Bowen’s favorite early-round fits
content: Which rookies fit the best with their new NFL schemes? We picked out 15 who could thrive, including Seahawks guard Grey Zabel.

title: Why four of MLB's top closers are struggling -- and if they can bounce back
content: Emmanuel Clase is just one of baseball's elite 2024 relievers who has had issues this season. But all hope might not be lost ... yet.

title: Welcome aboard: These are college football's top newcomers
content: From top recruits to big-time transfers, these players look to impact the College Football Playoff hopefuls.

title: Inside the goals of WNBA's next CBA -- travel, roster size, and yes, pay
content: Increased salaries, revenue sharing and salary cap are among the issues being negotiated for WNBA's new CBA.

title: Lamine Yamal may be the best teenage player ever. Where does he go from here?
content: Lamine Yamal is only 17 and he's one of the world's best players, and he's probably the best teenager ever -- better than Messi was at that age.

title: Alonso to leave Leverkusen, Madrid beckons
content: Xabi Alonso has confirmed he is leaving Bayer Leverkusen at the end of the season, with the Spanish coach expected to join Real Madrid.

title: Pulisic leads Milan rally with goal and assist in win
content: Santiago Gimenez and Christian Pulisic powered AC Milan to a crucial 3-1 home win over Bologna on Friday, a victory that not only kept their slim top-four hopes flickering but also set the stage for a tantalising Coppa Italia final clash on Wednesday.

title: Arteta warns fans: Finding striker will be tough
content: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta has reiterated his desire to sign a striker this summer but said the position is one of the hardest to fill.

title: Liverpool boss Slot 'disappointed' by TAA exit
content: Liverpool head coach Arne Slot has said he is "disappointed" that defender Trent Alexander-Arnold has decided to leave the club this summer but has backed the Reds to adapt following his departure.

title: Cunha using suspensions as a 'huge lesson'
content: Wolves forward Matheus Cunha has said he puts a lot of pressure on himself when it comes to discipline after being suspended twice and receiving a red card this season.

title: Liverpool's Salah named Footballer of the Year
content: Liverpool forward Mohamed Salah has been voted the Football Writers' Association (FWA) Footballer of the Year.

title: Amorim on Keane criticism: 'We can do better'
content: Ruben Amorim says Manchester United must accept criticism of their Premier League form, but insists he has had to sacrifice domestic games to chase Europa League glory.

title: NBA playoff futures: Pacers favored to win series over Cavs
content: An updated listing of the odds to win the NBA championship and Finals MVP following Wednesday's games.

title: Kevin Durant to D.C.? How major league pickleball groups pulled off rare ownership swap
content: The Major League Pickleball franchises known as the D.C. Pickleball Team and Brooklyn Aces exchanged name rights.

title: Different claims made to Pope Leo XIV's fandom after election
content: The Cubs and White Sox paid tribute to newly elected Pope (and Chicago native) Leo XIV amid a fandom debate.

title: Raleigh in fantasy's top 25? Webb destined for Cy Young? Don't be surprised
content: Eric Karabell looks into the crystal ball to tell fantasy baseball managers what might come to pass in the not-too-distant future.

title: 6-team mock draft: Is Ionescu a first-rounder?
content: Where did Sabrina Ionescu and the other stars on the Liberty land? Here's how our second fantasy women's basketball mock draft played out.

title: Setting records and continuing a legacy: CJ Kirst is carrying on his family name
content: CJ Kirst is just the latest Kirst to make a name for himself and is leading Cornell into the NCAA tournament.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Barça, Madrid to fight Bayern for Tah
content: Bayern are negotiating with Jonathan Tah, but the Germany defender has options. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: At long last, Michigan State aligns with Larry Nassar survivors
content: Nassar survivors and MSU president Kevin Guskiewicz announced a new assessment of the school's culture.

title: Pak drones flying over Khasa Cantt in Amritsar destroyed; Army releases video
content: Pakistan's military aggression escalated with drone strikes near western borders, prompting India's 'Operation Sindoor.' Armed drones targeting Amritsar were destroyed, as confirmed by the Indian Army. Explosions and sirens rattled Jammu following suspected drone incursions. Cross-border artillery exchanges intensified along the LoC, impacting Rajouri and Poonch.

title: Nur Khan, Murid and Rafiqui: Why these 3 Pakistan air bases were targeted by India
content: Tensions escalate as Pakistan reports India launched missiles at its air bases, triggering retaliatory strikes. Pakistan claims interception of most missiles, targeting Indian facilities in response. The conflict follows a deadly attack in Kashmir, blamed on Pakistan by India. Amidst rising tensions, both sides accuse each other of cross-border attacks, including drone incursions and airstrikes, further destabilizing the region.

title: 'Find ways to de-escalate': US secy of state speaks with Pak army chief Asim Munir
content: Amid escalating tensions, US Secretary of State Marco Rubio has urged Pakistan's army chief Asim Munir to de-escalate hostilities with India, offering US assistance for constructive talks. This follows retaliatory strikes by Indian forces on Pakistani air bases and terror launch pads after cross-border provocations, including drone attacks targeting key Indian infrastructure.

title: Operation Sindoor: IT ministry shares dos and don'ts for internet users
content: Following Operation Sindoor, MeitY issued an advisory for Indian internet users, emphasizing responsible online behavior and caution against misinformation. The advisory outlines dos and don'ts, including sharing verified information and avoiding posts inciting violence. The Ministry of Information & Broadcasting has also advised OTT platforms to discontinue content originating from Pakistan in the interest of national security.

title: EaseMyTrip, Cox & Kings suspend travel to Azerbaijan & Turkey, 'join' 'boycott'
content: Following escalating tensions between India and Pakistan after the Pahalgam attack, Indian travel companies like EaseMyTrip and Cox & Kings are taking a stand against Turkey and Azerbaijan due to their pro-Pakistan stance. EaseMyTrip advises caution when visiting these nations, while Cox & Kings has paused new travel offerings, urging Indian travelers to consider the geopolitical environment.

title: Watch: Army destroys Pak posts, terror launch pads used for drone attacks in Jammu
content: Following Pakistani drone attacks targeting Indian military and civilian sites, India retaliated by destroying key Pakistani posts and terrorist launch pads near Jammu. Pakistan claims its airbases were targeted, vowing retaliation and temporarily closing its airspace. India remains on high alert, activating missile systems and continuing counter-drone operations along the LoC after the Pahalgam terror attack and 'Operation Sindoor'.

title: Gold for India! Men's compound team hits bullseye at Archery World Cup
content: India shines at the Archery World Cup Stage 2 in Shanghai. The team clinched gold in the compound men's team event. Indian women secured silver in their team event. Abhishek Verma and Madhura Dhamangaonkar won bronze in the mixed team competition. These wins highlight India's growing strength in compound archery.

title: After sharing Army's 'Justice is Served' message, Zoho co-founder says: We must …
content: Zoho co-founder Sridhar Vembu has publicly expressed his support for the Indian Armed Forces' launch of Operation Sindoor, which targeted terrorist infrastructure in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Jammu and Kashmir. The operation was a response to the Pahalgam terrorist attack and aimed to hold those responsible accountable.

title: 'Pakistan will not be able to ... ': Ganguly gives massive verdict
content: Sourav Ganguly commented on the BCCI's decision to suspend IPL 2025 for a week due to escalating India-Pakistan tensions. He expressed hope for a swift resumption, emphasising the importance of completing the tournament. The Punjab Kings-Delhi Capitals match in Dharamshala was halted abruptly due to security concerns, with players and staff transported to Delhi via special train.

title: 'Reimburses for all ordnance': Omar Abdullah hits out at IMF for $1bn loan to Pakistan
content: Omar Abdullah criticized the international community and IMF for approving a $1 billion loan to Pakistan amidst heightened tensions and cross-border conflict. He suggested the funds could indirectly support Pakistan's military actions. The IMF approved the disbursement despite India's opposition and concerns that the funds might be misused for terrorism, leading India to abstain from the vote.

title: England open to hosting remainder of IPL 2025 after week's suspension
content: Following security concerns amidst escalating tensions between India and Pakistan, the Indian Premier League was suspended on Friday by a week. While the BCCI hopes to complete the tournament in India, England has emerged as a potential alternative host. The ECB is open to discussions, with suggestions including finishing the IPL before India's Test series or in September.

title: Amazon founder Jeff Bezos loses world's second-richest man title to his competitor
content: Mark Zuckerberg's fortune has surged past Jeff Bezos, making him the world's second-richest person, according to the Bloomberg Billionaires Index. This shift occurred as Meta's shares outperformed Amazon's, with Meta reporting strong first-quarter revenue. Meanwhile, Elon Musk remains the wealthiest individual, boosted by increased Tesla shares following his commitment to reduce time spent on government duties.

title: Manjrekar rips into Rohit Sharma: 'His current fitness levels ... '
content: Rohit Sharma's Test retirement has ignited debate, with Sanjay Manjrekar citing his recent slump and fitness concerns. Manjrekar highlighted Sharma's poor performance, averaging 10.9 in his last nine matches. Sharma, 38, announced his exit via Instagram, amidst scrutiny and leadership change speculations. Despite a strong Test career with 4,301 runs, his recent form dipped.

title: Senior J&K official killed, 2 injured in Pakistan shelling in Rajouri
content: A senior government officer was killed in Pakistani shelling in Rajouri district of Jammu and Kashmir early Saturday. Additional Deputy Commissioner Rajouri, Raj Kumar Thapa, succumbed to injuries after his residence was struck by an artillery shell. Two of his staff members were also critically injured.

title: G7 nations urge India, Pakistan to exercise maximum restraint
content: G7 nations have condemned the terrorist attack in Pahalgam and urged India and Pakistan to exercise maximum restraint amid rising military tensions. They called for immediate de-escalation and encouraged direct dialogue for a peaceful resolution, expressing deep concern for civilian safety.

title: Loud explosions heard in Srinagar, Rajouri, Jalandhar: What we know so far
content: Early Saturday morning, multiple explosions rocked Pakistani military bases, escalating tensions with India following recent strikes. Pakistan claims Indian jets fired missiles at key airbases, though most were reportedly intercepted. Blackouts were enforced in Jammu and Kashmir's Akhnoor and Punjab's Jalandhar amid reported explosions and drone sightings, heightening fears of a wider conflict.

title: India-Pakistan tensions: Delhi airport issues travel advisory
content: Delhi Airport has resumed normal operations but advises passengers to expect potential delays due to heightened security measures amid India-Pakistan tensions. Thirty-two airports across Northern and Western India faced temporary closures for civil flight operations. Drones were spotted at twenty-six locations near the International Border and Line of Control, raising security concerns.

title: Bill Gates on his 'last chapter': People will say a lot of things, but...
content: Bill Gates will donate his wealth through the Gates Foundation. This will happen over the next 20 years. The Gates Foundation will close in 2045. Gates aims to reduce his net worth by 99%. The foundation will focus on global health and poverty. Gates wants to address urgent problems. He hopes to save millions of lives with this accelerated plan.

title: 'Pakistan using civilian air traffic as shield, putting lives at risk': FS Misri
content: India has strongly condemned Pakistan for endangering civilian air traffic by using it as a shield during drone and missile attacks across the international border. Wing Commander Vyomika Singh highlighted that Pakistan did not close its airspace despite launching an attack on May 7, risking the safety of commercial flights.

title: Soldier from Andhra Pradesh, 2 civilians killed in Pakistan firing at LoC
content: Pakistani shelling across the Line of Control resulted in casualties. An Army jawan, M Murali Naik, lost his life. A woman in Uri and a man in Poonch also died. Six other civilians sustained injuries due to the intense firing. Indian troops retaliated effectively. A family in Uri was injured while fleeing, resulting in the death of Nargis Bano.

title: 32 airports in India to be closed till May 15 - check full list
content: Operation Sindoor impact on air travel: Due to ongoing India-Pakistan tensions under 'Operation Sindoor', several airports in North and North-Western India remain closed, with flight cancellations extended until May 15 by airlines like Air India, IndiGo. For flight travel at other airports, passengers are being advised to arrive at airports at least three hours before departure due to enhanced security measures, including secondary ladder point checks and restricted visitor access.

title: ‘Don’t hit morale’: Not the time to release SSC officers, SC tells Army
content: Amidst the ongoing 'Operation Sindoor' against Pakistan, the Supreme Court has temporarily halted the discharge of 69 Short Service Commission Officers, including 47 women. The court emphasized the need to maintain morale during the Indo-Pak tensions, suggesting their skills could be utilized elsewhere. The decision follows arguments about discriminatory practices in granting Permanent Commissions, especially given recent rulings on women's eligibility.

title: Ajay Devgn and Riteish Deshmukh starrer ‘Raid 2’ joins Rs 100 crore club
content: The highly anticipated 'Raid 2,' starring Ajay Devgn and Riteish Deshmukh, has achieved blockbuster status. The film opened strongly on May 1, 2025, earning over Rs. 19 crore. After a successful nine-day run, 'Raid 2' has now crossed the coveted Rs. 100 crore mark, solidifying its box office success with a total of ₹ 100.75 Cr.

title: Court junks complaint against Rahul for 'PM not OBC by birth' remark
content: A Jaipur court dismissed a complaint against Rahul Gandhi regarding alleged casteist remarks against PM Modi. The court stated it lacked jurisdiction to determine caste or gotra. The complaint stemmed from Gandhi's claim during a Bharat Jodo Nyay Yatra that Modi wasn't OBC by birth, inciting unrest, leading to the dismissal.

title: Measles cases in US cross 1,000: Early symptoms, prevention tips to know
content: A significant measles outbreak grips America. The US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention confirms over 1,000 cases across 31 states. Children are particularly affected. Unvaccinated individuals account for a large percentage of infections. Hospitalization is required in some cases. The CDC highlights symptoms like fever, cough, and a distinctive rash. Vaccination remains the most effective preventive measure.

title: AI can predict cancer survival by analysing an individual's selfie
content: Researchers at Mass General Brigham have created FaceAge, an AI tool that estimates biological age from facial features. A study of over 6,000 cancer patients revealed that those with an older FaceAge had poorer survival rates. Integrating FaceAge with clinical assessments improved the accuracy of predicting survival outcomes, potentially revolutionizing patient care through tailored treatment plans.

title: 'Bahut achcha tha': BCCI thanks Indian Railways for special train - Watch
content: Amid escalating India-Pakistan border tensions, the IPL 2025 match between Punjab Kings and Delhi Capitals in Dharamsala was abruptly halted on Thursday. The BCCI, prioritising safety, coordinated with Indian Railways to evacuate players and staff via a special train to Delhi. Consequently, the IPL 2025 season has been suspended for a week on Friday.

title: Amid India-Pak tensions, WFH, manufacturing ramp-down at some companies
content: Amid rising India-Pakistan tensions, companies are taking precautions to protect employees and minimize operational impact. Dabur has adjusted factory hours in Jammu, while Nestle's Punjab factory continues normal operations. E-commerce firms are adjusting delivery timelines in border states, but distributors report sufficient stock levels, preventing widespread supply disruptions or panic buying.

title: India flags Pak’s terror financing at IMF; abstains from bailout vote
content: India-Pakistan tensions: India has voiced strong concerns at the IMF's Executive Board meeting regarding bailout packages for Pakistan, citing its poor track record and potential misuse of funds for terrorism. India highlighted Pakistan's repeated reliance on IMF programs, questioning their effectiveness and the country's economic policies.

title: US gives India a free hand to manage Pak despite salutary advice to de-escalate
content: The Trump administration signals a hands-off approach to potential India-Pakistan conflict, deeming it "none of our business." While urging de-escalation, the US won't dictate terms, allowing India to manage regional affairs. New Delhi asserts its right to retaliate against Pakistan's alleged support for terrorism, presenting evidence of collaboration between Pakistani military and proscribed terrorists.

title: Angel Reese eyes WNBA redemption - Can record-breaking rookie lead?
content: Angel Reese aims to lead the Chicago Sky to victory after a challenging rookie season marked by individual records but team struggles. Following an injury and significant roster changes, including a new coach and veteran additions, Reese is focused on expanding her game and contributing to a winning culture. She is determined to achieve championship aspirations.

title: Saudi Arabia says making efforts to de-escalate tensions between India and Pakistan
content: The Foreign Ministry said that upon the directives of the Saudi leadership, Minister of State for Foreign Affairs Adel Al-Jubeir visited India and Pakistan on May 8 and 9 as part of the Kingdom's "ongoing efforts to de-escalate tensions, end current military confrontations, and promote the resolution of all disputes through dialogue and diplomatic channels".

title: MBU students take a ‘STEP’ forward in English proficiency
content: 2,220 students of Mohan Babu University have completed the Standardised Test of English Proficiency programme being offered by The Hindu Group

title: CPI(M) calls for de-escalation of tension at border
content: CPI(M) leader M.A. Baby urges the Centre to give a fitting reply to Pakistan if the latter resorts to provocative actions

title: NIAB scientists perform CRISPR-based genetic manipulation to identify protein to halt zoonotic infection ‘Toxoplasmosis’
content: The WHO and FAO have ranked it as the fourth among food-borne infections of major concern; the infection is endemic in India with a reported seroprevalence of above 20% in humans and animals

title: A WW-II air raid shelter in Hyderabad that is now a library
content: The library was a two-storey structure on top of the bunker built on a 471 square yard plot taken on a 100 year lease; it had two rooms for scholars, one room for a watchman, a stock room and a reading room

title: Traffic diversion in Chennai for CM Stalin’s solidarity rally
content: The march  to be led by Chief Minister M.K. Stalin to support the Indian Defence Forces, is scheduled at 5 pm from Light House and will conclude at the War Memorial near Napier bridge.

title: Pawan has lunch with elderly woman who prayed for his win
content: The woman saved Rs 27,000 from her pension money to offer a ‘garaga’ to Goddess Vegulamma as part of her vow

title: Gravely concerned: Singapore on India-Pak tensions
content: Singapore had strongly condemned the April 22 terrorist attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam, which claimed 26 lives.

title: U.P. CM Yogi Adityanath unveils two initiatives with support of World Bank
content: Expressing gratitude for the World Bank’s continuous support, Mr. Adityanath praised the role of the international organisation in helping Uttar Pradesh to move closer to its vision of becoming a $1 trillion economy.

title: Sitamarhi MP Devesh Chandra Thakur donates one-year basic salary to armed forces
content: While speaking to The Hindu, Devesh Chandra Thakur said the armed forces are continuously engaged in protecting the country so he also wanted to make a contribution by donating his one year salary, which is around ₹15 lakh

title: Air India suspends Tel Aviv flights till May 25
content: Air India, the only Indian carrier to operate direct services to Tel Aviv, normally has five weekly flights to the Israeli city from Delhi

title: Govt. to notify GBG Act on May 15, paving the way for restructuring BBMP
content: With the implementation of this Act, the BBMP — currently governed under the BBMP Act, 2021 — will cease to exist in its present legal form.

title: Operation Sindoor LIVE: Armed drones from Pakistan flying over Khasa Cantt, Amritsar, destroyed, says Army
content: Operations presently normal at Delhi airport; J&K govt official, toddler among five killed in intense Pakistan shelling

title: Can India repeat Operation Trident of 1971?
content: Indian Navy’s Vidyut-class missile boats had Pakistan by its jugular vein then; though both nations possess advanced equipment, what gives India an edge is its well-stocked hi-tech anti-ship missiles, ballistic missiles, and a host of surface-to-air missiles and air-to-air strike weapons, say experts

title: Odisha heightens coastal and strategic security amid rising tensions
content: CM Mohan Charan Majhi stated that credible intelligence inputs had prompted heightened vigilance around the Integrated Test Range at Chandipur, India’s premier missile testing facility, and Jagannath Temple in Puri

title: West Bengal CPI(M) calls for de-escalation of India-Pakistan military conflict
content: CPI(M) had supported the first phase of Operation Sindoor against terrorism; Md Salim says no one wins in the war of attacks and counter-attacks

title: Recently upgraded air defence guns take down Pak drones
content: Equipping air defence guns with air burst ammunition is a key lesson learned from the Ukraine war where drones have played a significant role

title: In Goa, a stampede and screams before sunrise
content: Over a lakh devotees gathered for north Goa’s annual Lairai jatra, a procession held in Shirgao village, leading to the Shree Lairai Devi temple. Then, there was a mishap on the steep hill; a rope barricade was broken, and chaos ensued. Within a few minutes, six were dead and over 80 injured in a stampede that now has the State administration and the temple committee arguing over who was at fault and who should govern the religious institution, finds Purnima Sah

title: IIT-Madras launches course to prevent workplace accidents
content: Aims is to skill professionals from manufacturing, mining, and energy sectors, enhancing safety protocols

title: Taslima Nasreen free to move anywhere in India, confirms Union Ministry
content: The Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change, in a letter, has confirmed that the exiled Bangladeshi author has been granted an Indian visa of appropriate category and duration, allowing her the freedom to move anywhere in India, including Kolkata

title: New Kerala is a reality, not a dream, says Pinarayi
content: Coming down on the Centre, Mr. Vijayan said the Union government had failed to support Kerala during emergencies and even blocked aid offered by Malayalee expatriates.

title: The Hindu Huddle 2025: Disintegration of world order is significant because the attack has come from within: Tirumurti
content: Mr. Tirumurti said the disintegration had not started with the U.S. or President Trump, but rather when China entered the World Trade Organization as a non-market economy, and with the emasculation of Russia

title: India a part of wider trend of eroding press freedom in South Asia: report
content: The Annual South Asia Press Freedom Report 2024-25 flags several concerning trends, including a ‘growing trust deficit in media outlets’, ‘choking of independent websites’ and the extreme precarity of gig workers

title: "Multiple Pak Drones Over Amritsar Engaged, Destroyed": Indian Army Shares Video
content: Indian forces downed multiple Pakistani drones over Amritsar early this morning as Islamabad continues to target military installations and civilian air facilities in India.

title: India Pakistan Attack LIVE: NSA Ajit Doval Meets PM, Briefs On Ongoing Situation
content: Operation Sindoor India Pakistan Attack LIVE Updates: A blackout was enforced and sirens went off after artillery firing and explosions were heard in Jammu this evening.

title: US Top Diplomat Calls Pak Army Chief, Urges De-escalation With India
content: Marco Rubio also offered US assistance in starting "constructive" talks between the two countries to "avoid future conflicts.

title: Shashi Tharoor Asked To Explain Operation Sindoor Name. His 'Blood' Reply
content: The colour of sindoor is not very different from the colour of blood spilt by the perpetrators of the Pahalgam terror attack, Congress MP Shashi Tharoor told a Saudi Arabian news channel while explaining the name of India's counterstrike

title: "Fake": Centre Debunks Claims Of Indian Strikes On Nankana Sahib Gurudwara In Pakistan
content: The government also dismissed claims that India's power grid has been rendered dysfunctional in a cyberattack by Pakistan.

title: Video: Indian Army Destroys Pak Post Near Jammu Used For Tube Drone Launch
content: Indian forces have destroyed several Pakistani military posts and a terror launchpad in retaliation as Pakistan continued to escalate the situation, sources said.

title: Senior J&K Official Killed After Pakistani Shell Hits His House In Rajouri
content: A Jammu and Kashmir government officer was killed as Pakistan targeted civilian areas in Rajouri and other parts of the Union Territory this morning. Chief Minister Omar Abdullah said he had no words to express his shock and sadnessthe

title: "To All Illegal Aliens": Trump Launches Paid Self-Deportation Program
content: Donald Trump lashed out at immigrants, blaming "a full-scale invasion" of those who stay in the US illegally for crime and violence.

title: "Not Sure How...": Omar Abdullah Slams IMF For $1 Billion Loan To Pak
content: Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah on Saturday slammed the International Monetary Fund (IMF) for approving the immediate disbursement of about USD 1 billion to Pakistan amid heightening tensions with India.

title: G7 Nations Condemn Pahalgam Terror Attack, Call For De-Escalation Between India, Pak
content: The G7 nations on Saturday urged immediate de-escalation amid rising tensions between India and Pakistan following alleged missile strikes.

title: Air India Suspends Tel Aviv Flights Until May 25
content: Air India has announced that all flights to and from Tel Aviv will remain suspended until May 25, 2025, amid escalating tensions between India and Pakistan.

title: Pakistan Shuts Airspace After India's 'Using Civilian Flights As Shields' Charge
content: Pakistan today shut down its airspace for all air traffic, hours after India accused it of using commercial flights as shields amid drone attacks.The decision, notified through a Notice to Airmen (NOTAM), came amid heightened tensions.

title: Delhi Airport Resumes Normal Operations, Issues Travel Advisory To Passengers
content: Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport resumed normal operations in the early hours of Saturday and issued an advisory to passengers amid heightened security preparedness due to ongoing tensions between India and Pakistan.

title: European Leaders To Make Unprecedented Ukraine Visit For Talks With Zelensky
content: The leaders of France, Britain, Germany and Poland will make an unprecedented joint visit to Ukraine on Saturday for talks with President Volodymyr Zelensky, vowing to ratchet up pressure on Russia until it agrees a ceasefire.

title: Prohibitory Order Imposed In Indore Till July 4
content: In a bid to uphold peace and public order within Indore, Police Commissioner Santosh Kumar Singh has enacted "prohibitory order" under Section 163 of the Indian Civil Code 2023.

title: No Not An Option? Why India Abstained From Vote On Pak Funds At IMF
content: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) on Friday approved a fresh loan of about $1 billion to Pakistan under the ongoing Extended Fund Facility.

title: Pak Drones Seen At 26 Indian Locations, Blackouts In Several Cities
content: Drones, including the armed ones, were sighted at 26 locations in India, ranging from Jammu and Kashmir to Gujarat, along both the International Border and the Line of Control with Pakistan, the Indian Army said on Friday.

title: 32 Airports Shut for Civilian Flights Till May 15: Aviation Regulator
content: Thirty-two airports across northern and western parts of the country, including Srinagar and Amritsar, have been closed for civilian flight operations till May 15, according to the civil aviation regulator.

title: Exclusive: PM Modi Should Emulate Israel's Golda Meir Over Pak Terror, Says Expert
content: Amid Pakistan's major escalation over India's precision strikes on its terrorist infrastructure and terror camps, top global security analyst Michael Rubin told NDTV that India should take a leaf from Israel's book in its "war against terror".

title: Trump Urges "Quick De-Escalation" Of India-Pak Conflict: White House
content: US President Donald Trump wants to see the conflict between India and Pakistan de-escalate "as quickly as possible," the White House said on Friday.

title: Watch: DC and PBKS players arrive in Delhi from Dharamsala
content: Following escalating tensions, the 2025 IPL season is temporarily suspended, prompting teams to manage squad relocations. Overseas players are anxious, leading the BCCI and teams to expedite travel arrangements for them to return home. Delhi Capitals and Punjab Kings players have already arrived in Delhi after their Dharamsala fixture was halted, while other teams are making similar arrangements.

title: Mother's day 2025: Best messages, quotes, wishes and images
content: Mother's Day is a perfect time to express love and gratitude to the special women in our lives. A heartfelt message, whether lighthearted or sincere, can brighten her day more than any gift. Simple notes, borrowed quotes, or even a quick phone call can create lasting memories. Expressing appreciation improves well-being and strengthens connections, making this Mother's Day truly special.

title: Supreme Court is being forced to take on many avatars: Justice Nagarathna
content: Justice Nagarathna, heading a Bench, observed that cases that vitally need the attention of the highest court hardly get it as litigants appeal to the apex court at the drop of a hat

title: Days after HC order, Adivasi body insists it will go ahead with its symbolic hunt
content: The dispute between the Jain and Adivasi communities over worshipping rights on the Parasnath hill or Marang Buru has been going on for more than a century

title: Tamil Nadu Congress Committee Charitable Trust land dispute reaches Madras High Court
content: Justice N Mala orders notice, returnable by May 15, to the trust on an arbitration application filed by a private company

title: BSF official reviews preparedness in north Bengal frontier
content: During his visit, Mahesh Kumar Aggarwal, Additional Director General of BSF’s Eastern Command, was briefed about the ‘prevailing security situation and emerging challenges’ across the India-Bangladesh Border.

title: Army chief empowered to bring in Territorial Army personnel
content: Out of 32 TA Infantry Battalions, 14 can be called upon for deployment in various Army commands such as Southern Command, Eastern Command and so on

title: Telangana HC directive to government on payment of benefits to retired employee
content: Observes that the government failing to provide mandatory benefits to its superannuated employees demonstrates the present fiscal state of affairs

title: CPI expresses concern over inflammatory, misleading content aired on news channels
content: CPI General Secretary criticises TV channels for spreading inflammatory content post Operation Sindoor, calls for responsible reporting

title: Study finds bankruptcy fears impact trade credit decisions of small businesses
content: IIT Madras researchers’ experiments show rational models mirror situation better than theoretical models

title: Operation Sindoor: Security stepped at Chennai airport, passengers advised to come in advance
content: The check-in counters at Chennai airport will be closed 75 minutes ahead of departure time. Additional manpower has been deployed across the airport, say sources

title: Amit Shah meets chiefs of BSF, CISF to assess preparedness
content: State governments empowered to undertake all necessary actions for protection of people and property, ensure uninterrupted functioning of vital services during a hostile attack.

title: Don’t believe rumours; enough stocks of grains, edible oil, sugar, pulses with Centre: Joshi
content: Union Food Minister Pralhad Joshi says the country currently has food grain stocks many times higher than the normal requirement

title: Centre issues NOTAM, closes at least 32 airports for civilian flights until May 15
content: The aviation regulator said that the closure of certain traffic segments over Delhi and Mumbai was also being extended until the early hours of May 15

title: Health Minister Nadda chairs review meeting on Emergency Health Systems preparedness
content: Nadda briefed on the urgent and comprehensive measures taken to strengthen health systems and resources across the country

title: Delhi HC closes case after Ramdev pledges no more offensive remarks against Rooh Afza
content: Justice Amit Bansal said the averments of Ramdev and Patanjali Foods Ltd. in their affidavits were binding on them and decreed the suit in favour of Hamdard National Foundation India

title: Blackouts in multiple Punjab districts; govt of Haryana asks employees not to leave station
content: Government officials have described the situation as “dynamic”, necessitating enhanced readiness across departments.

title: Pakistan used 400 drones, possibly from Turkiye: India
content: On the LoC, heavy shelling by Pakistan continued using heavy calibre artillery guns and armed drones resulting in some losses and injuries to Indian Army personnel

title: India’s steadfast unity in itself is a challenge to Pakistan: Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri
content: Kartarpur Corridor suspended due to prevailing tension; Foreign Secretary accuses Pakistani forces of targeting gurdwaras both in India and within their own territory in a ‘desperate attempt’ to spread communal discord and mislead the world

title: Pakistan’s complicity in terrorism exposed, says U.P. Chief Minister
content: CM Yogi Adityanath accuses Pakistan of patronising terrorism; calls for unity and support for armed forces following Pahalgam attack

title: Operation Sindoor: Mehbooba, Mirwaiz urge India, Pakistan to ‘de-escalate’
content: J&K Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha vows to end terrorism, assures soldiers of support in Baramulla’s Uri

title: India abstains from IMF vote to give more funds to Pakistan, flags its ‘poor track record’
content: In a statement, the govt raised the possibility of Pakistan misusing IMF funds for state-sponsored cross-border terrorism.

title: Railways to operate special trains in view of airport closures
content: Special trains were arranged by Indian Railways for the passengers who were stranded due to the closure of Jammu and Chandigarh airports, said a spokesperson from Ministry of Railways

title: Congress holds ‘Jai Hind Yatra’ to express solidarity with armed forces
content: Leaders rally across States amid heightened India-Pakistan tensions; party asserts strong support for national security

title: Stay off streets, stay home: J&K CM Omar Abdullah after loud blasts in Jammu
content: Omar Abdullah urges calm as blasts, blackout and sirens reported in Jammu; residents advised to remain indoors amid heightened tensions

title: Railways approves survey for mega terminal at Devanahalli to decongest Bengaluru’s rail network
content: The terminal is expected to be located along the Yelahanka–Devanahalli–Chikkaballapur corridor and will serve as the city’s fourth major coaching terminal

title: Women, students, lawyers and Sachivalayam staff take out rallies in support of ‘Operation Sindoor’
content: Members of the Loyola Walkers Association organised a rally at Benz Circle and raised slogans against the terrorist groups and condemned the attacks.

title: The Hindu Huddle begins with focus on border threats
content: Hosting a packed auditorium at the Taj West End, The Hindu Huddle also brought its viewers a diverse range of panel discussions on contemporary subjects including on climate change, AI, women’s cricket, liberal education, and how women directors are transforming the landscape of cinema across India.

title: Grand library in Tirunelveli will be named after Quaid -E-Millath: CM
content: Steps will be taken to establish a Chair on Islamic Tamil literature in University of Madras, says the Chief Minister at the inauguration of ninth World Islamic Tamil Literature conference

title: It is not a court’s duty to tell media to delete or take down content: Supreme Court
content: The verdict by a Bench of Justices A.S. Oka and Ujjal Bhuyan came in a challenge to a Delhi High Court order directing the takedown or deletion of online content related to a defamation case between ANI and Wikimedia Foundation

title: Projecting how good the expansion Valkyries will be in their inaugural WNBA season
content: the WNBA is the first expansion team in women's sports history to do so prior to its first season . the franchise surpasses 15,000 season-ticket deposits . a lot of eyes are on the Valkyries as teeming with a crowd of fans .

title: 2025 college baseball hitter rankings: The best hitters in the game
content: the best hitters in college baseball are purely in the batter's box . the best pitcher in Omaha, Nebraska is junior, 24 HRs, 52 RBIs, .326 BA Neville has been going off this season .

title: Power Rankings: Tigers make top-5 debut as Mariners, Royals are on the rise
content: the battle between the national league powerhouses for the no. 1 spot continues in week 6 . los Angeles is retaking the top spot from new york, with the Tigers breaking in at the No. 5 spot . the Yankees, the Mariners and the royals are the week's biggest risers .

title: Post-spring Way-Too-Early Top 25: Where do Texas and Notre Dame rank?
content: the college football calendar is finally slowing down for a few weeks . it's a good time for the second edition of the 2025 Way-Too-Early Top 25 . there's no. 1 with Penn State jumping from no. 3 .

title: 📈 Lamar's Druski 'Coulda Been Records' cameo
content: lamar Jackson appeared in 50 Cent's "Power Book III: Raising Kanan" he made his acting debut in a comedic series where musical artists compete for a prize . before contestants entered the main audition stage, Jackson had to approve their preliminary audition .

title: FIFA confirms 48-team Women's World Cup in '31
content: the 2031 and 2035 women's football world cups will take place in the u.s. and the uk . the tournament will be expanded from 32 to 48 nations . it's the only bid on the table, and will be ratified by FIFA in 2026 .

title: NBA conference semifinals: Cavs take Game 3 behind Mitchell's 43 points
content: the second round of the 2025 playoffs is here, and our insiders have you covered for every game of the Eastern and Western conference semifinals . the no. 4 seed Indiana Pacers kicked off the East semis by taking a two-game lead over the No. 1 seed Cleveland Cavaliers .

title: Ranking this weekend's fights: From Navarrete-Suarez to Lubin-Holmes
content: sportsmail breaks down the best card and ranks all the notable fights this weekend . the 36-year-old wants to close his career with a world title fight at the City Ground . he is at least boxing in front of his home city fans in Nottingham .

title: Bold predictions on Matthew Golden, Travis Hunter, other top rookies
content: Packers head coach Matt LaFleur joins "the Pat McAfee Show" and talks about adding Matthew Golden to his roster . a dozen of our experts weigh in with their opinions on everything that went down in Green Bay .

title: Is there a path for Belal to catch GSP?
content: belal "Remember the Name" Muhammad won the welterweight title last month . the nine-year veteran has been overlooked by fans and opponents alike . "i don't need the world to believe in me," he said .
